meanings.definition: The fact of two or more events or circumstances happening or existing at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The concurrency of the two meetings caused confusion.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the concept of concurrency using a clock analogy.
meanings.sent3: The concurrency of the dog barking and the baby crying made for a chaotic morning.
meanings.sent4: The concurrency of the traffic lights turning green created a smooth flow of cars.
meanings.sent5: The concurrency of the thunder and lightning made the storm seem more intense.

meanings.definition: The state of being simultaneous or parallel.
meanings.sent1: The concurrency of the two trains on separate tracks was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The software was designed to handle multiple tasks with concurrency.
meanings.sent3: The concurrency of the two siblings finishing their homework at the same time surprised their parents.
meanings.sent4: The concurrency of the two rivers flowing side by side was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The concurrency of the dancers' movements on stage created a mesmerizing performance.
